sif3.infra.rest.consumer
Class AbstractConsumer

java.lang.Object
  sif3.infra.rest.consumer.AbstractConsumer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Consumer
Direct Known Subclasses:
StudentPersonalConsumer, StudentsConsumer
public abstract class AbstractConsumer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Consumer

This is the core class that a developer will use to implement their consumers. Each consumer for each object type MUST extends this class. It forms the link between the high level consumer implementation and the low level infrastructure functions which this class abstracts.
It forms the link between the SIF3 functions/infrastructure and the data model that shall be transported over the SIF3 Infrastructure. The marshal and unmarshal factories required by this class as well as the two core abstract methods getSingleObjectClassInfo() and getMultiObjectClassInfo() are the key to link between data model and infrastructure.

Author:
Joerg Huber

Constructor Detail

AbstractConsumer

public AbstractConsumer(java.lang.String serviceID,
                        MarshalFactory marshaller,
                        UnmarshalFactory unmarshaller)
This method initialises a consumer. This includes but is not limited to reading the property file applicable for the consumer and connecting to all environments this consumer needs to interact with. It also makes the consumer aware of the data model it will deal with through the marshaller and unmarshaller provided to this constructor.

Parameters:
serviceID - is the same for all consumers that belong to a service. This is the 'adapter id' and not the id belonging to a specific consumer and object type.
marshaller - Marshaller applicable for the Data Model this consumer deals with.
unmarshaller - Unmarshaller applicable for the Data Model this consumer deals with.
Method Detail

getSingleObjectClassInfo

public abstract ModelObjectInfo getSingleObjectClassInfo()
Provides information about the Single Object Type to be dealt with in this consumer.

Returns:
See desc.

getMultiObjectClassInfo

public abstract ModelObjectInfo getMultiObjectClassInfo()
Provides information about the 'collection-style' Object Type to be dealt with in this consumer. It is mainly used in Bulk operations.

Returns:
See desc.

shutdown

public abstract void shutdown()
This method is called when a consumer service is shut down. It can be used to free up internally allocated resources as well as clean-up other things.

removeEnvironments

public abstract boolean removeEnvironments()
Return TRUE if environments shall be removed/deleted. Return FALSE if environments shall be kept and only disconnect. Note if the environment is removed all data that might be queued with that environment will also be removed/lost. This method must be used with care.

Returns:
see desc.

createMany

public java.util.List<BulkOperationResponse> createMany(java.lang.Object data,
                                                        java.util.List<EnvironmentZoneContextInfo> envZoneCtxList)
                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                        PersistenceException,
                                                        ServiceInvokationException
Description copied from interface: Consumer
This method will create many objects in one call. The 'data' parameter is a collection-style object that is defined in the data model (i.e. StudentPersonals which is a collection of StudentPersonal).

Specified by:
createMany in interface Consumer
Parameters:
data - The 'collection' object. Each object in that collection will be created.
envZoneCtxList - If this List is null or empty then it is assumed that the operation is performed for ALL environments this consumer is connected to. It is performed for the default Zone and Context of each environment. If this list is not empty then the action is only performed for the environments in the list and the Zone and Context listed. If a given environment has more than one zone and/or context then each combination must be a separate entry in this list.
Returns:
A list of responses corresponding to the List of envZoneCtx. If the envZoneCtx was null then the list of responses holds a response for each environment this consumer is connected to. The creation of data was in each environment's default zone and context.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the parameters is invalid.
PersistenceException - Some data could not be persisted. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.
ServiceInvokationException - Service on provider could not be executed. See error log for details.

retrieve

public java.util.List<Response> retrieve(PagingInfo pagingInfo,
                                         java.util.List<EnvironmentZoneContextInfo> envZoneCtxList)
                                  throws PersistenceException,
                                         UnsupportedQueryException,
                                         ServiceInvokationException
Description copied from interface: Consumer
This method is used to retrieve any number of objects. This is achieved in terms of 'paging' through the list of objects. The consumer is expected to provide paging information to tell the provider which objects in the list shall be returned. The first page has the number 0.

Specified by:
retrieve in interface Consumer
Parameters:
pagingInfo - Page information to be set for the provider to determine which results to return.
envZoneCtxList - If this List is null or empty then it is assumed that the operation is performed for ALL environments this consumer is connected to. It is performed for the default Zone and Context of each environment. If this list is not empty then the action is only performed for the environments in the list and the Zone and Context listed. If a given environment has more than one zone and/or context then each combination must be a separate entry in this list.
Returns:
A list of responses corresponding to the List of envZoneCtx. If the envZoneCtx was null then the list of responses holds a response for each environment this consumer is connected to. The creation of data was in each environment's default zone and context.
Throws:
PersistenceException - Some data could not be persisted. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.
UnsupportedQueryException - The query provided with this request is not supported (NOT YET IMPLEMENTED FUNCTIONALITY)
ServiceInvokationException - Service on provider could not be executed. See error log for details.

updateMany

public java.util.List<BulkOperationResponse> updateMany(java.lang.Object data,
                                                        java.util.List<EnvironmentZoneContextInfo> envZoneCtxList)
                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                        PersistenceException,
                                                        ServiceInvokationException
Description copied from interface: Consumer
This method will update many objects in one call. The 'data' parameter is a collection-style object that is defined in the data model (i.e. StudentPersonals which is a collection of StudentPersonal). Each object in the collection can either hold the full object or only parts of the object that needs updating.

Specified by:
updateMany in interface Consumer
Parameters:
data - The 'collection' object. Each object in that collection will be updated.
envZoneCtxList - If this List is null or empty then it is assumed that the operation is performed for ALL environments this consumer is connected to. It is performed for the default Zone and Context of each environment. If this list is not empty then the action is only performed for the environments in the list and the Zone and Context listed. If a given environment has more than one zone and/or context then each combination must be a separate entry in this list.
Returns:
A list of responses corresponding to the List of envZoneCtx. If the envZoneCtx was null then the list of responses holds a response for each environment this consumer is connected to. The creation of data was in each environment's default zone and context.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the parameters is invalid.
PersistenceException - Some data could not be persisted. An error log entry is performed and the message of the exceptions holds some info.
ServiceInvokationException - Service on provider could not be executed. See error log for details.

Description copied from interface: Consumer
This method updates the object given by its resourceID.

Specified by:
updateSingle in interface Consumer
Parameters:
data - The actual object (i.e. Student). It holds the values of the object that need to be updated. It can either hold the full object or only parts of the object that needs updating.
resourceID - The Id of the object to be updated.
envZoneCtxList - If this List is null or empty then it is assumed that the operation is performed for ALL environments this consumer is connected to. It is performed for the default Zone and Context of each environment. If this list is not empty then the action is only performed for the environments in the list and the Zone and Context listed. If a given environment has more than one zone and/or context then each combination must be a separate entry in this list.
Returns:
A list of responses corresponding to the List of envZoneCtx. If the envZoneCtx was null then the list of responses holds a response for each environment this consumer is connected to. The creation of data was in each environment's default zone and context.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - One of the parameters is invalid.
